com.raweng.built

Class BuiltNotification

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.raweng.built.BuiltNotification

  • public class BuiltNotification
extends java.lang.Object
    To broadcast push notifications using Built.io Backend library.
    Author:
    raw engineering, Inc

    • Method Detail

      • setHeader

        public void setHeader(java.lang.String key,
             java.lang.String value)
        To set headers for Built.io Backend rest calls.
        Scope is limited to this object only.
        Parameters:
        key - header name.
        value - header value against given header name.

        Example :
         // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltNotification notification = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b").notification();
 notification.setHeader("custom_header_key", "custom_header_value");

      • removeHeader

        public void removeHeader(java.lang.String key)
        Remove a header for a given key from headers.
        Scope is limited to this object only.
        Parameters:
        key - header key.

        Example :
         // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltNotification notification = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b").notification();
 notification.removeHeader("custom_header_key");

      • sendNotificationInBackground

        public void sendNotificationInBackground(java.lang.String message,
                                java.lang.String[] userUid,
                                com.raweng.built.BuiltResultCallBack callback)
        To send push notification.
        Parameters:
        message - message which will be sent with the notification.
        userUid - Specify an array of user's uids to send notifications to.
        callback - BuiltResultCallBack object to notify the application when the request has completed.

        Note: You can add following filter with the notification.

      • You can set timestamp on which you want Built.io Backend to send the notification. You can set timestamp using setTimestamp(Calendar).
      • To send the notification at users' timezone. Use sendLocalPush().



        • Example :
         // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltNotification notification = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b").notification();
 notification.sendNotification("message", new String[]{"user1","user2"},new BuiltResultCallBack() {
      @Override
      public void onCompletion(ResponseType responseType, BuiltError builtError) {

      }
 });

      • sendNotification

        public BuiltSynchronousResponse sendNotification(java.lang.String message,
                                        java.lang.String[] userUid)
        To send push notification.
        Parameters:
        message - message which will be sent with the notification.
        userUid - Specify an array of user's uids to send notifications to.

        Note: You can add following filter with the notification.

      • You can set timestamp on which you want Built.io Backend to send the notification. You can set timestamp using setTimestamp(Calendar).
      • To send the notification at users' timezone. Use sendLocalPush().



        • Example :
         // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltNotification notification = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b").notification();
 BuiltSynchronousResponse response = notification.sendNotification("message", new String[]{"user1","user2"};

 if(response.getBuiltError() == null){

 }

      • setTimestamp

        public void setTimestamp(java.util.Calendar calendar)
        Calendar instance to set the notification sent time. If not specified, the notification will be sent immediately.
        Parameters:
        calendar - Calendar instance.

        Example :
              // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
      BuiltNotification notification = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b").notification();
      notification.setTimestamp(calendar);

      • sendLocalPush

        public void sendLocalPush()
        Whether to send the notification local to the users' timezones. Useful only if setTimestamp(Calendar) is set.

        Example :
              // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
      BuiltNotification notification = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b").notification();
      notification.sendLocalPush();
